summary: This document is an email correspondence from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley regarding the arrival of Tom Pritzker at Palm Beach airport. Epstein requests a driver to pick up Pritzker and inquires if he should go directly to Epstein's house. The email emphasizes confidentiality and potential attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, coordinating the pickup of Tom Pritzker.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email, involved in the logistics of Pritzker's arrival.

persons.name: Tom Pritzker
persons.context: Pritzker is mentioned as arriving at Palm Beach airport and needing transportation.

connections.description: Epstein is coordinating Pritzker's arrival and transportation, indicating a social connection.
Staley is likely acting on behalf of Epstein in arranging logistics for Pritzker.

events.title: Arrival of Tom Pritzker
events.description: Tom Pritzker is scheduled to arrive at Palm Beach airport.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is coordinating the pickup of Tom Pritzker from Palm Beach airport.
Tom Pritzker's arrival is scheduled for March 13, 2010.
The email emphasizes confidentiality and potential attorney-client privilege.
Jes Staley is involved in the logistics of Pritzker's arrival.
Pritzker's assistant has no return flight plans as of the time of the email.
